tweets.html:
Whenever people refer to Joss Whedon as a genius, I like to remind them that he approved of Kendra's godawful Jamaican accent. #Buffy

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) July 30, 2012

Shane/Danielle have a strong Xander Crews/Grace Ryan dynamic going on. Of course, the 4 people who get that reference don't watch #BB14

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) July 30, 2012

In season three of Newsroom, Will & McKenzie will be hired to produce Summer Olympics, and they will do a much better job.

— Conor Yunits (@conoryunits) July 29, 2012

Ryan Seacrest Wins Gold For Freestyle Mindless Blather.

— Mike Scully (@scullymike) July 29, 2012

Watching men's swimming once every 4 years is like finding out what it's like being a woman looking at a magazine stand every single day.

— Francis Lam (@Francis_Lam) July 29, 2012

Recording tonight's #Olympics coverage. My Tivo: "This is a live event, would you like to add 1 hour?" My Tivo is a comedian.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 29, 2012

In 2014, NBC's Olympics coverage will consist of Brian Williams Skype-ing a summary of the day's events from his hotel room each night.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) July 29, 2012

When I watch the #Olympics I'm inspired to be athletic. Then I hear things like Ryan Lochte hasn't eaten dessert in 6 yrs and I think, 'nah'

— Adriano (@adrianoooo) July 29, 2012

If I DVR the NBC tape-delay coverage is that inception?

— Dan Hopper (@DanHopp) July 29, 2012

BUTTAFUQQINFLY WORLD RECORD!!!! Dayummmm! Go USA!

— Samuel L. Jackson (@SamuelLJackson) July 30, 2012

Are the Olympic sportscasters posing for prom photos? Why are they so close, so angled just so? http://t.co/dHiCzgUP

— Amelie Gillette (@amelieg) July 30, 2012

Just kiss already... #Olympics pic.twitter.com/GbAmCvue

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) July 30, 2012

Why am I watching qualifying rounds? You had 4 years to figure this out. #Olympics

— Alex Baze (@bazecraze) July 30, 2012

Dear NBC- can you please replace your Gymnastics color commentary with the adult voices from Charlie Brown? #olympics

— Skee-Ball Librarian (@oodja) July 30, 2012

If you need an Olympic break, Lamar Odom is going to the dentist on the Kardashians. I'm not joking. This is television in 2012.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 30, 2012

FYI: I am an expert on gymnastics now.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 30, 2012

Nothing will convince you to avoid pushing your kid into sports like watching gymnastics parents.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) July 30, 2012

Parents of Olympic gymnasts are pretty chill, seem like a fun hang.

— Jeff Lyons (@usedwigs) July 30, 2012

I hope my country's 16-year-old prepubescent overcoached childhood-deprived gymnasts beat yours.

— God (@TheTweetOfGod) July 30, 2012

Why in God's name is there not a Big Brother type show taking place in the Olympic Village? Why? I will accept no answer.

— Andy Bobrow (@abobrow) July 30, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Yelling at the screen during the Olympics feels vastly different than yelling during The Newsroom. Unless it's during NBC coverage.

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) July 30, 2012

Gymnastics need to be re-imagined as an obstacle course involving an escaped bear or puma. #bored

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 30, 2012

Gentlemen, if you haven't gone gay for every male swimmer, I question your humanity.

— Michael Ian Black (@michaelianblack) July 30, 2012

Brian Williams spoiler-alert instructions for Olympics results so convoluted I have no idea what he wanted us to do. #NBC

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) July 30, 2012

The women's gymnastics team all needs to win the gold medal for intense faces.

— Chris(tmas name) (@djgristle) July 30, 2012

Team USA women's gymnastics: Number one in mirthless hugs!

— Chris(tmas name) (@djgristle) July 30, 2012

It just hit me that Danny Boyle's Opening Ceremony was the dramatized version of Hugh Grant's speech from Love, Actually. Seriously.

— Zack Stentz (@MuseZack) July 30, 2012

All I can think when watching balance beam is "Get off that fucking thing, goddamnit, get off that terrible, dangerous thing right now."

— Joe R (@Randazzoj) July 30, 2012

"You know how doing flips is hard as shit?" "Yeah." "Let's have teenage girls do them on a thin-ass board." "OK." - Balance beam inventors

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 30, 2012

In a way, NBC is letting us all feel the same excitement Biff Tannen experienced when he got a hold of that sports almanac!

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) July 30, 2012

Synchronized diving must be like how a drunk sees regular diving all the time. #NBC #Olympics

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) July 30, 2012

Synchronized diving!! (Now they are just making shit up) #olympics

— Mike Rotman (@mikerotman) July 30, 2012

I could never be an Olympic athlete because I just don't like hugging people that often.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 30, 2012

Also, I suck at sports.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 30, 2012

Are swimmers the biggest bros in the Olympics? Are they as bro'ed out as skiers? We need better metrics for this.

— David Roth (@david_j_roth) July 30, 2012

The great thing about women's gymnastics are the real-world practical applications.

— Michael Ian Black (@michaelianblack) July 30, 2012

Hey, NBC is showing little sports snippets between commercial blocks!

— 🌎Joshua Malina🌎 (@JoshMalina) July 30, 2012

Hey, is it just me or does the Chinese national anthem sound vaguely like the theme song to some kind of 50's TV Western?

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) July 30, 2012

Notice how nobody has said anything about "tape delay in the age of Facebook?" It's all "in the age of Twitter."

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) July 30, 2012

Bob Costas seems like a guy who would angrily complain, at length, to a hotel front desk clerk.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) July 30, 2012

Gymnasts' bodies look like someone is squeezing their butt so tight that the rest of their body gets pushed up into their shoulders

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) July 30, 2012

Jordyn Wieber's backpack just seems so insanely horribly poignant right now

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) July 30, 2012

The BCS is ruining the all-around competition. Jordyn Wieber should definitely be in over Michigan.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) July 30, 2012

Cut to: Jordan Wieber crying. NBC: "It's still not time to talk to Jordan Wieber."

— Doree Shafrir (@doree) July 30, 2012

Artificial drama in “taking a moment” in a tape delayed event. And maybe it’s okay if we don’t interview her on the spot, guys.

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) July 30, 2012

NBC is "feeding off [Jordyn Wieber's] pain, says R.

— June Thomas (@junethomas) July 30, 2012

Bela & Bob >>>> Stephen A. & Skip

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 30, 2012

Poor Jordyn Wieber is going to have her clutch gene debated tomorrow by First Take, unless Tebow takes his shirt off again that is.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 30, 2012

Bela Karolyi is my favorite Bond villain... #Olympics

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) July 30, 2012

Bela Karolyi now looks like an animatron of an Old West bartender.

— Paula Pell (@perlapell) July 30, 2012

The only good thing about that 2 gymnasts from 1 country rule is that it gave us an outraged Bela Karolyi.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 30, 2012

I think Béla Károlyi should be the commentator for every sport at the Olympics...and the NFL. He and Madden would be a joy to listen to.

— Dr. Tait Martin (@DrTaitMartin) July 30, 2012

Bela Karoli: ERMAHGERD JERDYERN WERBER #Olympics

— K.A. Holt (@karianneholt) July 30, 2012

The Olympics say the 100-meter butterfly is coming up. I can only assume they mean Mothra!

— Silas Lesnick (@silaslesnick) July 30, 2012

"great eye contact with the judges" "pulled the bangs from her forehead" & other things they don't say about male gymnasts

— Sara Eckel (@saraeckel) July 30, 2012

Does anyone know when the IOC delivers the gold medals to Twitter users for their triumphant win in mocking NBC for its Olympic coverage?

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 30, 2012

@mousterpiece REMEMBER- while you can help with the US team medal, only the top 2 American tweeters are eligible for individual competition.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 30, 2012

Gymnast hugs look like the worst hugs on Earth.

— Josh Hara (@yoyoha) July 30, 2012

When the Olympics are over I'm going to take the US Ladies Gymnastics Team to Kohls and get them some bras that don't pancake their byubes.

— Paula Pell (@perlapell) July 30, 2012

STILL can't believe someone did the Cabbage Patch during the Parade of Nations. This lady is my hero. pic.twitter.com/lJsgIl5H

— price 🔇 (@pricepeterson) July 30, 2012

My favourite thing about the #Olympics - the incredibly brief time it takes me to feel qualified to make expert comment on minor sports.

— Mark Stewart (@markboynz) July 30, 2012

My favorite recurring TV character is probably the guy who got caught two separate times on To Catch A Predator.

— Brandon McCarthy (@BMcCarthy32) July 30, 2012

Basically, Nina Tassler announced that CBS crushes everybody like a grape, as usual. And will do so again. She did not add, "Bitches."

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 29, 2012

In all seriousness, no other network understands its brand and audience better than CBS.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) July 29, 2012

Amazing that DR WHO hasn't done an Xmas ep where the London Eye is rolling down the streets of the city firing lasers at everyone.

— Barefoot Drummer Boy (@barefootjim) July 29, 2012

If Liz Cheney had ever produced one of Palin's FNC segments she'd change her tune.

— Muto-Ho-Ho! (@JoeMuto) July 30, 2012

I usually like Apple ads. I want to smack their Genius like a piñata till he bursts with iPod shuffles.

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) July 30, 2012

I think that dirty bandaid is the sickest thing #TrueBlood has ever shown.

— Kim! (@vaupelganger) July 30, 2012

When Jason Stackhouse is the smartest person onscreen, then he must be talking to Sookie. #TrueBlood

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) July 30, 2012

Time to sit and appreciate Carla Gugino's beauty for an hour. #PoliticalAnimals

— BurnThemAll (@aboleyn) July 30, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Time to go get angry at a TV show instead of at myself for watching it. #TheNewsroom

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) July 30, 2012

Shit is it Spoiler O'Clock already?!

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) July 30, 2012

Watching the Newsroom Rudy scene. The writers made me watch Rudy at our retreat. It is an examination of an unhinged Notre Dame fan, no?

— Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) July 30, 2012

I so want to insert a shot of Fox & Friends into the montage of old-timey broadcasters in #TheNewsroom opening credits. Or maybe Jesse Camp.

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) July 30, 2012

I love the women of Sorkin and I don't care who knows it!!

— Jenni Konner (@JenniKonner) July 30, 2012

My weekly "I'm excited to hate on Newsroom" tweet to anger the fans of Newsroom/people who say I just shouldn't watch it. :D

— Euge (Adam WarRock) (@eugewarrock) July 30, 2012

Oh good, it's an episode about internet comments. THIS IS GONNA BE AWESOME. #TheNewsroom

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 30, 2012

I need to throw more parties on Sunday night. #TheNewsroom should never be watched alone.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 30, 2012

When SNL does its Newsroom parody, will they create an opening credits that draws from old Weekend Updates?

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) July 30, 2012

Guess what, guys? More supposedly brilliant women being dumb. I know. You're shocked. #TheNewsroom

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 30, 2012

"Gucci???" I hate you, #TheNewsroom. Flames...on the side of my face...heaving...

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 30, 2012

Oh my, Sorkin really does hate and fear the internet. #newsroom

— Jeff Jarvis (@jeffjarvis) July 30, 2012

And then Will says something I've thought for months. I'm back in! #TheNewsroom #SoManyFeelings

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 30, 2012

Ah, the "begrudgingly seeing a therapist because hero can't sleep" trope! Sorkin hasn't used that one in like eleven years!

— Joe Reid (@joereid) July 30, 2012

Seriously, though: The #Newsroom blew all its goodwill it sorta built last week, and then some.

— Mark W. (@marqualler) July 30, 2012

tweets.html:
Guess what, everybody? Will's gonna fix the internet! Thanks, Will! #Newsroom

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) July 30, 2012

The biggest problem with #TheNewsroom is characters doing or saying things so dumb they can't be believed.

— Jeverett15 (@jeverett15) July 30, 2012

The single most unintentionally hilarious line on #TheNewsroom (ever): "The page views offset the ratings drop."

— Andrew Wallenstein (@awallenstein) July 30, 2012

If you were someone who criticized Will McAvoy for being a bully & thought Sorkin was blind to that, tonight's ep of #TheNewsroom is for you

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) July 30, 2012

What if they made a decent-to-great #Newsroom and everybody snarked

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) July 30, 2012

Yes, it has flaws, but tonight's episode of the #Newsroom on @HBO has me convinced it's a keeper. Blatantly steals f/ West Wing. Fine by me!

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) July 30, 2012

Oh, HBO. Stop bragging about Emmy mom’s for that Hemingway & Gelhorn thing. It’s obviously a joke nomination.

— Kim! (@vaupelganger) July 30, 2012

So happy that Cranston-centric #TotalRecall promo felt like studio needed #BreakingBad audience more than AMC needed ad revenue.

Twitter is about to switch over from vampire/Olympics to methamphetamine/Olympics. Prepare yourselves.

I will not feel sorry for Skyler. I will not feel sorry for Skyler. I will not feel sorry for Skyler. I will not… #BreakingBad

WOW! #BreakingBad's possible new lab plan is GENIUS. I won't spoil but this is.... #SMH in awe.

Oh fuck! They got my homie Landry cooking meth?! #breakingbad #texasForever

Looks like Landry got into bad company when he moved to Albuquerque...

Walt needs to buy Brock a Xbox. He knows why. #brreakingbad

Every #BreakingBad tweet tonight from this point on: Shut up! Shut up! Shut up! Shut up! Shut up! SHUT UP!

"Shut up shut up SHUT UP SHUT UP SHUT UP SHUT UP!!!!" Skyler on "Breaking Bad." Also, my new ringtone.

Wasn't there an entire episode in which Walt obsessed over 1 fly contaminating the lab? And now he wants to cook in houses overrun by bugs?

Someone needs to mash up a scene from tonight's Breaking Bad with a scene from Punch-Drunk Love. You know what I'm talking about.

they should have a nicer television than that. #BreakingBad

If this were a Christmas episode, Walt and his son would be watching the Godfather trilogy on AMC. #breakingbad

You know what Jesse Pinkman, I would have taken that tortilla too. #BreakingBad

Was that a Mob Week promo embedded within #BreakingBad?

We must keep public unions strong and pay teachers well if only to stop them from becoming monstrous psychopaths. #breakingbad

You put Victor into the sun?! #BreakingDevelopment

If you fly too close to the sun, you get your throat cut. Apparently Greek mythology is Walter White's academic blind spot. #BreakingBad

Walter White would probably be the worst person to split a check with.

Fun with words: If Walt is "Breaking Bad," Jesse is "Broken, Bad." #BreakingBad
